docs.lead_paragraph: It is just past 7 on a Tuesday morning, and the nurses at Hlabisa Hospital are praying for deliverance. The stronger patients straighten their ailing bodies and chime in on wobbly legs. The bedridden croon through cracked lips. ''We are children of God,'' sing the nurses, clinging to their tattered hymnals in the dingy, overcrowded ward. ''We believe in the Lord. What we have in our hearts, heaven has put there.''

headline.main: A South African Hospital Fights AIDS and Despair

docs.abstract: Death and Denial, series on ravages of AIDS epidemic sweeping South Africa; focuses on community of Hlabisa in KwaZulu Natal Province, which has highest HIV infection rate in adults in South Africa; epidemic has swamped efforts of local hospital to cope with rising number of cases; there is shortage of staff and beds and general erosion of care as doctors and nurses struggle to conduct routine checks and tests; number of cases admitted has nearly doubled in last 10 years; none of infected patients have access to life-saving AIDS drugs available in West; workers are left questioning faith in medicine, their role as caretakers and future of community where parents can no longer assume their children will live beyond 35; map; photos (M)
docs.snippet: It is just past 7 on a Tuesday morning, and the nurses at Hlabisa Hospital are praying for deliverance. The stronger patients straighten their ailing bodies and chime in on wobbly legs. The bedridden croon through cracked lips.     ''We are children...

docs.lead_paragraph: A FEW months before my father died in January, at 77, he told my mother the words she had long vowed never to heed. ''After I'm gone, get rid of this house,'' he told her about their home in Connecticut. ''Keeping it up will bankrupt you.''

headline.main: Planning Ahead for Peace of Mind

docs.abstract: James Schembari column on long-term care insurance, which can cover nursing home care, assisted living, home health care and homemaker services; notes that 39 percent of buyers in 1999 were under 65, up from 29 percent in 1996, and that policies are becoming retirement planning tool (M)
docs.snippet: A FEW months before my father died in January, at 77, he told my mother the words she had long vowed never to heed.    ''After I'm gone, get rid of this house,'' he told her about their home in Connecticut. ''Keeping it up will bankrupt you.''
